bibl.title: Leiffman v. Stein. Matter of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: Julius Leiffman vs RP Stein Sheriff} Matter of Habeas Corpus

The said Defendant having, on this 9th day of June 1880, brought said plaintiff Julius Leiffman, before the Judge at his Chambers in Colbert as commanded by the writ, together with his return to said writ, and the Judge having duly considered the same together with the evidence of R P Stein and John G Justice witnesses sworn and examined touching the cause of the restraint of plaintiff and resent F. District attorney will present in court and the Court funding no legal cause for the restraint or imprisonment of the said Julius Leiffman, it is ordered that he be and is hereby discharged from Custody
